abstract.para: You can start and stop &systemd; services by using units which are resources. These resources are defined using configuration file, called unit files. A unit is a resource that the system knows how to operate on and manage. The target units are service units, which have a .service suffix. For service management tasks, you do not have to add the .service because &systemd; knows that you want to execute a service.
